13 enum HalBoardLedPins {
14 #if HAL_LED_COUNT <= 1
15  BOARDLED0 = 0,
16  BOARDLED1 = BOARDLED0,
17  BOARDLED2 = BOARDLED0,
18  BOARDLED3 = BOARDLED0,
19  BOARD_ACTIVITY_LED = BOARDLED0,
20  BOARD_HEARTBEAT_LED = BOARDLED0
21 #endif
22 #if HAL_LED_COUNT == 2
23  BOARDLED0 = 0,
24  BOARDLED1 = 1,
25  BOARDLED2 = BOARDLED0,
26  BOARDLED3 = BOARDLED1,
27  BOARD_ACTIVITY_LED = BOARDLED0,
28  BOARD_HEARTBEAT_LED = BOARDLED1
29 #endif
30 #if HAL_LED_COUNT == 3
31  BOARDLED0 = 0,
32  BOARDLED1 = 1,
33  BOARDLED2 = 2,
34  BOARDLED3 = BOARDLED1,
35  BOARD_ACTIVITY_LED = BOARDLED0,
36  BOARD_HEARTBEAT_LED = BOARDLED1
37 #endif
38 #if HAL_LED_COUNT >= 4
39  BOARDLED0 = 0,
40  BOARDLED1 = 1,
41  BOARDLED2 = 2,
42  BOARDLED3 = 3,
43  BOARD_ACTIVITY_LED = BOARDLED0,
44  BOARD_HEARTBEAT_LED = BOARDLED1
45 #endif
46 };
47 #endif

61 void halInternalInitLed(void);

66 #if defined(STACK) || defined(MINIMAL_HAL)
67 typedef uint8_t HalBoardLed;
68 #else
69 typedef enum HalBoardLedPins HalBoardLed;
70 #endif
71 // Note: Even though many compilers will use 16 bits for an enum instead of 8,
72 // we choose to use an enum here. The possible compiler inefficiency does not
73 // affect stack-based parameters and local variables, which is the
74 // general case for led paramters.
75
